abstract.para: &firewalld; is a dynamic firewall management service that provides a flexible and efficient way to control network traffic on Linux systems. It allows modifications without interrupting existing connections. Benefits of using &firewalld; are:

listitem.para: Dynamic configuration:Apply changes instantly without breaking existing connections.
User friendly interface:Zones and services simplify complex firewall rules.
Abstraction: There is no need to directly manipulate iptables rules for common scenarios.
Persistent configuration: Easy management of rules that survive reboots.
Persistent configuration: By default, &firewalld; operates on a deny-all principle by blocking all incoming traffic unless explicitly allowed.
